column2: Average Class Size and Class Size Distribution (Elementary)\r2016-172016-172016-172016-172017-182017-182017-182017-182018-192018-192018-192018-19\rAverage# of# of# ofAverage# of# of# ofAverage# of# of# of\rGrade\rClassClasses*Classes*Classes*ClassClasses*Classes*Classes*ClassClasses*Classes*Classes*\rLevel\rSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSize\r1-2021-3233+1-2021-3233+1-2021-3233+\rK\r221422232114\r\r1\r26424132113\r\r2\r2632542313\r\r3\r23152023254\r\r4\r32123221352\r\r5\r3221303343\r\rOther**\r81\r*Numbe r of classes indicates how many classes fall into each size category (a range of total students per class).\r** “Other” category is for multi-grade level classes.\r\r\rProfessional Development provided for Teachers\r\rMeasure2017-182018-192019-20\rNumber of school days dedicated to Staff Development and Continuous Improvement404141\r\rThe district annually holds professional development days in which teachers are offered a broad-based variety of professional learning opportunities in\rcurriculum and instructional practice in support of a continuous cycle of improvement. Professional learning opportunities include grade level and/or\rcontent-specific programming on full and partial days as well as early student release day opportunities. Student achievement data continues to be the\rdetermining factor in the selection of professional learning topics. The primary areas of focus for professional learning in the last three years have been\rin the area of supporting teachers as it relates to math
column8: as\rwell as the use of student data to improve instructional practice. Professional learning is developed and facilitated by district staff
column10: as well as consultants and coaches who specialize in content-area pedagogy. Professional learning is structured in job-embedded workshops\rand professional learning communities which include collaborative lesson planning
column13: and\rstudent work/data analysis. Professional learning for all teachers includes strategies and pedagogy to support all learners access rigorous
column14: grade-level\rstandards. All professional learning includes a special emphasis on supporting the development of English learners’ development of academic language\rand literacy.\r\rBeginning in 2017 through 2020
column15: all teachers participated in six days of systematic
column16: district-wide professional learning with a focus on instructional\rstrategies in support of our three student success drivers: academic discourse
column19: several opt-in days\rof various ongoing professional learning offerings were held to differentiate among grade and content levels and included standards-aligned instructional\rpractices in support of all learners
column20: including English learners and students with disabilities; college and career readiness; and social-emotional support.\r\rIn addition to the aforementioned
column21: district and site learning has focused on developing Professional Learning Communities (PLC) focused on a cycle of\rcontinuous improvement. In accordance with this initiative
column22: teachers work in grade levels and study data and student work along with curriculum\rframeworks
column25: and state-approved adoptions to establish learning goals
column26: plan lessons and develop common\rformative assessments. Teachers meet regularly each week and also for extended learning opportunities each trimester. The district initiative to develop\rPositive Behavior Interventions and Supports (PBIS) provides multiple training opportunities throughout the year for the PBIS team. At Hodge
